intro: Oenothera cespitosa var. longiflora, commonly known as the tall evening primrose, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It features upright, branched stems that can grow up to 2 meters in height, adorned with lance-shaped, gray-green leaves. The plant produces showy yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its fibrous root system makes it a hardy species capable of thriving in a variety of soil types. The plant is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
